com.att.research.xacmlatt.pdp.std.functions

Class FunctionDefinitionRegexpMatch<I>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.att.research.xacmlatt.pdp.std.functions.FunctionDefinitionBase<java.lang.Boolean,I>
      • com.att.research.xacmlatt.pdp.std.functions.FunctionDefinitionRegexpMatch<I>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - the java class for the data type of the function Input arguments
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    FunctionDefinition

    public class FunctionDefinitionRegexpMatch<I>
extends FunctionDefinitionBase<java.lang.Boolean,I>
    FunctionDefinitionRegexMatch implements FunctionDefinition to implement the XACML 'type'-regex-match predicates as functions taking two arguments, the first of String, representing a regular expression, and the second of the type for that specific predicate, and returning a Boolean for whether the regular expression matches the string representation of the second argument. In the first implementation of XACML we had separate files for each XACML Function. This release combines multiple Functions in fewer files to minimize code duplication. This file supports the following XACML codes: string-regexp-match anyURI-regexp-match x500Name-regexp-match rfc822Name-regexp-match (in sub-class com.att.research.xacmlatt.pdp.policy.FunctionDefinition.FunctionDefinitionRegexpMatchRFC822 ) ipAddress-regexp-match dnsName-regexp-match
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.1 $
    Author:
    glenngriffin
